citations.title: **[Fast.ai Practical Deep Learning]( Code-first, gets you building quickly (Part 1, ~7 lessons)
**[Stanford CS229 lecture notes]( Skim for concepts you don't know (you can skip most math proofs)
[A high-bias, low-variance introduction to ML for physicists]( (Mehta et al., 2019) - excellent physics-oriented ML review
[Physics-informed neural networks]( (Raissi et al., 2019) - embedding physical laws in ML
**Key resource**: [Climate Change AI paper]( (Rolnick et al., 2019) - comprehensive survey of ML opportunities
**Dataset**: Use output from simplified climate models (e.g., [ClimateNet](
[Deep Learning Specialization]( (Coursera) - if you want structured content
[Dive into Deep Learning]( - interactive book with code
[ML for Physical Sciences workshops]( at NeurIPS
Apply for cloud credits: [Google Cloud research credits]( AWS, Azure
Use [Google Colab]( for free GPU access (limited)
